match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: England won by 5 wickets (with 8 balls remaining) (D/L method)

ground.name: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium, Sooriyawewa, Hambantota
ground.longName: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium, Sooriyawewa, Hambantota

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ali b Jordan 63 (62b 7x4 0x6 110m) SR: 101.61

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, goes to swing leg side again but this is mistimed and picks out mid-on! Another importantly-timed wicket for England just when the hosts were going well. Sangakkara cleared the front leg away again but got this high on the bat and it was a simple chance for Moeen Ali at waist height, hardly had to move. Well bowled from Jordan, back over the wicket and ran his fingers across it

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne not out 62 (47b 7x4 0x6 77m) SR: 131.91

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: got him! Woakes strikes early. It's a short delivery, not quite as wide as Kusal thought, he's a little cramped for room as he tries to cut and can't keep the ball down as it finds backward point
and another! Inroads for England. Kandamby's return is a brief one. Pushed at a short-of-a-length delivery outside off and just guides the ball at a nice catching height to slip.

swing again into the leg side, this time not timed at all, gets it high and Moeen takes the catch retreating from mid-on. Needed a little juggle but he held on. Perera fancied some leg side rope again but was off balance trying to swing away this shorter ball, got it high on the bat and Moeen did the rest, just about

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: a step down the track, swing at a length ball outside off and nicks it to the keeper! Wild stroke and Mathews falls just when England needed a wicket. A very poor choice, so unnecessary because the partnership was moving along very nicely. Got in a poor position, took a big swing, almost swung himself off his feet, and got a feather edge to Buttler

slower ball, goes to swing leg side again but this is mistimed and picks out mid-on! Another importantly-timed wicket for England just when the hosts were going well. Sangakkara cleared the front leg away again but got this high on the bat and it was a simple chance for Moeen Ali at waist height, hardly had to move. Well bowled from Jordan, back over the wicket and ran his fingers across it

headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Morgan b Woakes 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: got him! Woakes strikes early. It's a short delivery, not quite as wide as Kusal thought, he's a little cramped for room as he tries to cut and can't keep the ball down as it finds backward point

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Buttler b Finn 23 (19b 4x4 0x6 22m) SR: 121.05

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! It was back of a length again, think Finn rolled his fingers across the seam, Dilshan went for the cut and a comfortable edge went through to Buttler. Crucial blow.

dismissalText.commentary: Thilina Kandamby c Jordan b Woakes 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and another! Inroads for England. Kandamby's return is a brief one. Pushed at a short-of-a-length delivery outside off and just guides the ball at a nice catching height to slip.

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Buttler b Jordan 37 (45b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 82.22

dismissalComment.html: a step down the track, swing at a length ball outside off and nicks it to the keeper! Wild stroke and Mathews falls just when England needed a wicket. A very poor choice, so unnecessary because the partnership was moving along very nicely. Got in a poor position, took a big swing, almost swung himself off his feet, and got a feather edge to Buttler

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ali b Jordan 63 (62b 7x4 0x6 110m) SR: 101.61

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, goes to swing leg side again but this is mistimed and picks out mid-on! Another importantly-timed wicket for England just when the hosts were going well. Sangakkara cleared the front leg away again but got this high on the bat and it was a simple chance for Moeen Ali at waist height, hardly had to move. Well bowled from Jordan, back over the wicket and ran his fingers across it

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis c Finn b Root 12 (10b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: tries to line up a slog sweep to leg but mistimes it and Finn takes a smart catch moving across to his left at square leg. Mendis sweeping conventionally this time from outside off, didn't get hold of it at all and it rather looped to Finn's right, he moved quickly across to take a tumbling chance

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Ali b Woakes 8 (10b 0x4 1x6 14m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: swing again into the leg side, this time not timed at all, gets it high and Moeen takes the catch retreating from mid-on. Needed a little juggle but he held on. Perera fancied some leg side rope again but was off balance trying to swing away this shorter ball, got it high on the bat and Moeen did the rest, just about

dismissalText.commentary: Dhammika Prasad st Buttler b Bopara 22 (8b 2x4 2x6 12m) SR: 275

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, another mighty swing to leg is attempted but he misses and is stumped. Bopara totally deceiving the batsman who swung himself off his feet almost, got nowhere near it and Buttler had a very simple job to tick off the bails

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali run out (Herath/Sangakkara) 58 (40b 2x4 5x6 65m) SR: 145

dismissalComment.html: opens the face and presses wide enough of mid-off for a single but oh no!! Hales is rooted to the crease at the non-striker's end, Moeen has to get back but the throw is in time! What a complete disaster for England. There was a single available all day but for some reason Hales shuffled out of his ground a few yards but without turning to face his partner, shuffled back to the bowler's end, Moeen has almost run two and is short getting back to the striker's end

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler not out 55 (37b 9x4 0x6 46m) SR: 148.64

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Hales can't make the most of his life, he was itching to cut loose. Used his feet, it was a length delivery, and he heaved it to mid-on who just had to move a little to his left. Didn't really need to do that after the earlier reprieve and the six

the collapse is on! Morgan's problems continue. It was a short ball, not especially rapid but well directed around middle and leg, he went for the hook and the ball took a top edge with was comfortably held at long leg

brilliant from Sangakkara! Wonderful anticipation. He saw Bopara go down early for a paddle sweep and started to move to his left, and when the ball glanced off the face of the bat he snaffled the catch brilliantly almost by the edge of the cut strip.

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c Sangakkara b Prasad 34 (42b 5x4 0x6 45m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: full length angled across Cook who pushes at it and edges behind! Prasad with the breakthrough. A ball Cook should have left, it was a nothing stroke, played away from his body, and Cook's promising start comes to an end

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali run out (Herath/Sangakkara) 58 (40b 2x4 5x6 65m) SR: 145

dismissalComment.html: opens the face and presses wide enough of mid-off for a single but oh no!! Hales is rooted to the crease at the non-striker's end, Moeen has to get back but the throw is in time! What a complete disaster for England. There was a single available all day but for some reason Hales shuffled out of his ground a few yards but without turning to face his partner, shuffled back to the bowler's end, Moeen has almost run two and is short getting back to the striker's end

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Hales can't make the most of his life, he was itching to cut loose. Used his feet, it was a length delivery, and he heaved it to mid-on who just had to move a little to his left. Didn't really need to do that after the earlier reprieve and the six

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara c Sangakkara b Herath 6 (3b 0x4 1x6 4m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: brilliant from Sangakkara! Wonderful anticipation. He saw Bopara go down early for a paddle sweep and started to move to his left, and when the ball glanced off the face of the bat he snaffled the catch brilliantly almost by the edge of the cut strip.

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c NLTC Perera b Mathews 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: the collapse is on! Morgan's problems continue. It was a short ball, not especially rapid but well directed around middle and leg, he went for the hook and the ball took a top edge with was comfortably held at long leg

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: back and punching down the ground and that'll do it!

commentPostTextItems.html: So the series back to 2-1 with a morale-boosting victory for England and now we move back to Colombo on Sunday, it's another day game so a 9am local/4.30am GMT start. See you then...

Presentation coming up, surely Jos Buttler is Man of the Match for a superb matchwinning innings. Indeed he is. Here's a novelty, the winning captain Alastair Cook: "It's great to get over the line. We got a great start with Mo and the lads played great to win the game. We should have cruised it better than we did but got there in the end. I think they showed how hard it is to defend. Our fifth bowlers didn't quite get it right. We felt 235 was par and we played well to get there. It was a great wicket and credit to the groundstaff. My back flared up during the break but it was nice to score a few runs."

And Angelo Mathews: "The batters put up a good fighting score but the conditions were a bit wet but I thought we were poor in the field. The Duckworth-Lewis you can't rely on it but our bowlers weren't up to it today. Catches and no-balls have cost us. Thirimanne batted brilliantly and played so well with the tail. Mahela will be back for Colombo but we don't need to panic."

Sri Lanka put a good total up with the bat via Kumar Sangakkara and Lahiru Thirimanne, plus a few handy cameos, but, under pressure with the ball for the first time in the series, they have been found wanting. For a while they looked to have another squeeze on in the middle but England played the seamers much better today and manourved the spinners well too.

England, like in the first ODI, got a great start to this chase via Moeen Ali's blitz but again they wobbled in the middle. This time they steadied through Root and Buttler and just when they needed a kick found that big over to get the chase really into gear and in the end they cantered home. It was Buttler who struck out just at the right time, found the boundary when needed, building around Root who apart from two strokes was largely unnoticed but played a crucial anchor role when England were losing wickets around him.

A superb partnership between Joe Root and Jos Buttler have brought England home by five wickets and they reduce the arrears in this series to 2-1. A badly-needed victory for England and the series to liven up this seven-match series as we prepare to go back to Colombo.

commentTextItems.html: down the wicket and a lovely clean straight strike clears the boundary
floated up outside off, driven at and missed
set up for the paddle sweep then changed his mind and dabbed a ball just outside off to short third man
full on the stumps, calmly batted back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: England going to cruise home now, what a difference one no-ball makes eh!

commentTextItems.html: a shimmy down once more, smashed down to long-off on the bounce, flat and hard that went
and again, another full toss and whacked wide of long-off, fifty for Buttler, bringing his side home
down the wicket, turns it into a full toss and guided through extra-cover, the timing is superb and it's wide of long-off
down the wicket, squirts this away through midwicket and they can run hard for the second
goes to reverse sweep and misses it outside off
full on the stumps again, calmly pushed down to long-on

commentPostTextItems.html: That's desperately what England needed, a slice of luck, some decent hitting and suddenly it's no drama time. They should knock these off now...

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full length on the stumps, squirted out backward of square, it evades backward point and runs away from third man, four more!
length ball, heaved down the ground and...just over the head of mid-off. It was far from a clean hit but enough club to chip it over mid-off diving back and it skips away to the fence
full toss wide of off stump, Buttler cracks it for four past backward point, poor ball and Buttler puts it away
free hit...heaved off side but again Root doesn't really connect with it and it loops out over cover for just a single

commentPostTextItems.html: Far from fluent this from Root but effective so far...

commentTextItems.html: full again, tries to smash it off side but miscued and caught at extra-cover! It was very full, Root tried to give himself room to swing it away but squirted it straight to the fielder. They check the no-ball and Prasad has overstepped! What an error. A reprieve for Root, an extra for England and a free hit too, what a let off for Root
step across the stumps and scooped, nailed it for six over long leg, superb stroke, helped all the way, taken off a very full length on middle stump
outside off, cut hard again but this time Buttler can't pierce the field

commentPostTextItems.html: Better over for England but 30 for 0 isn't a worldly Powerplay when you're chasing 10-an-over...

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full on leg stump, dropped into the leg side, they sprint hard for two before long-on can get in
touch short, Buttler right back in his crease, pulled hard and gets it to the square fence

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alex Hales c BAW Mendis b Mathews 27 (29b 2x4 1x6 53m) SR: 93.1

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Hales can't make the most of his life, he was itching to cut loose. Used his feet, it was a length delivery, and he heaved it to mid-on who just had to move a little to his left. Didn't really need to do that after the earlier reprieve and the six

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root not out 48 (48b 2x4 2x6 90m) SR: 100
Ravi Bopara c Sangakkara b Herath 6 (3b 0x4 1x6 4m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: brilliant from Sangakkara! Wonderful anticipation. He saw Bopara go down early for a paddle sweep and started to move to his left, and when the ball glanced off the face of the bat he snaffled the catch brilliantly almost by the edge of the cut strip.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c NLTC Perera b Mathews 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: the collapse is on! Morgan's problems continue. It was a short ball, not especially rapid but well directed around middle and leg, he went for the hook and the ball took a top edge with was comfortably held at long leg

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler not out 55 (37b 9x4 0x6 46m) SR: 148.64

headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Hales can't make the most of his life, he was itching to cut loose. Used his feet, it was a length delivery, and he heaved it to mid-on who just had to move a little to his left. Didn't really need to do that after the earlier reprieve and the six

the collapse is on! Morgan's problems continue. It was a short ball, not especially rapid but well directed around middle and leg, he went for the hook and the ball took a top edge with was comfortably held at long leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full length angled across Cook who pushes at it and edges behind! Prasad with the breakthrough. A ball Cook should have left, it was a nothing stroke, played away from his body, and Cook's promising start comes to an end

brilliant from Sangakkara! Wonderful anticipation. He saw Bopara go down early for a paddle sweep and started to move to his left, and when the ball glanced off the face of the bat he snaffled the catch brilliantly almost by the edge of the cut strip.

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c Sangakkara b Prasad 34 (42b 5x4 0x6 45m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: full length angled across Cook who pushes at it and edges behind! Prasad with the breakthrough. A ball Cook should have left, it was a nothing stroke, played away from his body, and Cook's promising start comes to an end

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali run out (Herath/Sangakkara) 58 (40b 2x4 5x6 65m) SR: 145

dismissalComment.html: opens the face and presses wide enough of mid-off for a single but oh no!! Hales is rooted to the crease at the non-striker's end, Moeen has to get back but the throw is in time! What a complete disaster for England. There was a single available all day but for some reason Hales shuffled out of his ground a few yards but without turning to face his partner, shuffled back to the bowler's end, Moeen has almost run two and is short getting back to the striker's end

stories.summary: It's not just about wanting your side to win; there's also the matter of which players you want to do well

stories.seoTitle: Lahiru Thirimanne relishes absence of James Anderson
stories.summary: Angelo Mathews dubbed Lahiru Thirimanne's half-century the most encouraging aspect of Sri Lanka's five-wicket defeat in Hambantota as the batsman continued to prosper in the absence of James Anderson

stories.title: England morale boosted by successful run chase

stories.summary: England survived a mid-innings wobble to beat Sri Lanka by five wickets with eight balls to spare in Hambantota to reduce the deficit to 2-1 in a seven-match series

stories.title: England seek jungle reinvigoration
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota

image.longCaption: Alastair Cook sweeps during his first net at Hanbantota, Hanbantota, December 1, 2014

stories.title: Kandamby set for Sri Lanka comeback
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Thilina Kandamby set for Sri Lanka comeback
stories.summary: Sri Lanka are enjoying home conditions but have to do without Mahela Jayawardene in Habantota. Thilina Kandamby is set for a comeback as the hosts look to take a 3-0 series lead

image.caption: Thilina Kandamby's 63 made him the top scorer for Sri Lanka A
image.longCaption: Thilina Kandamby's 63 made him the top scorer, Sri Lanka A v Pakistan A, Triangular series, 2nd match, SSC, Colombo, August 26, 2010

videos.title: 'We made it hard for ourselves' - Cook
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
videos.seoTitle: 'We made it hard for ourselves' - Cook
videos.summary: England captain Alastair Cook spoke of his delight at defeating Sri Lanka in the third ODI but felt his side could have made things easier for themselves, adding he hoped to avoid a ban for a slow over rate

videos.title: 'Sloppy fielding cost us' - Mathews
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
videos.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews felt his team threw away the third ODI against England with poor fielding but praised Lahiru Thirimanne's batting performance

videos.title: Morale boosting win for England
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
videos.summary: Alan Gardner reports from the third ODI between Sri Lanka and England in Hambantota where the tourists hauled themselves back into the series thanks to a five-wicket victory.

videos.title: 'Need to adapt better as a team' - Finn
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
videos.seoTitle: 'Need to adapt better as a team' - Steven Finn
videos.summary: Steven Finn says England need to keep fighting as the team prepare to face Sri Lanka in the third ODI of the series.

videos.title: Opportunity for youngsters - Thirimanne
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
videos.summary: Sri Lanka vice-captain Lahiru Thirimanne believes the absence of Mahela Jayawardene from the third ODI against England presents a fantastic opportunity for the younger batsmen
